abstract: A Chinese freshman at an American public university will typically pay three times what an in-state student pays. And with increasing numbers of Chinese kids at U.S. colleges, even with a booming economy back home, how are they paying more than $50,000 a year? A high school educator from one of Beijing's leading schools explains the how, the why and the how much.

headline.main: Chinese Students Paying U.S. Tuitions — How? And Why?
